fun.connor.lighter.compiler

Class Combinations

  • java.lang.Object
    • fun.connor.lighter.compiler.Combinations

  • public final class Combinations
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for creating all pairwise combinations of a list (i.e. Cartesian product). This is used in the compiler several places to perform efficient global validations

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Combinations.Pair<T>
      Simple tuple of two objects

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      static <T> java.util.List<Combinations.Pair<T>> CombinationsOf(java.util.List<T> data)
      Perform the cartensian product of a list with itself.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • CombinationsOf

        public static <T> java.util.List<Combinations.Pair<T>> CombinationsOf(java.util.List<T> data)
        Perform the cartensian product of a list with itself. Creates exactly one instance of each pair of objects in the list without duplicates. No two pairs with the same elements are produced (order doesn't matter). There is no pair where both objects are the same.
        This method is used to check each object in a list against each other object in a list exactly once. Each pair contains one of
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the list elements
        Parameters:
        data - the list to generate combinations of
        Returns:
        the list of combinations
